channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Target joins Walmart in pulling back on DEI. But this big retailer and its shareholders are staying the course.
item.description: Target said that it was ending its diversity, equity and inclusion goals as it tries to align itself with an “evolving external landscape.”

item.title: Stock Investors Like Trump 2.0
item.description: Major indexes around the globe moved higher during President Trump’s first week in office.

item.title: ‘My retirement is going to be a disaster’: I’m 59 and have $45,000 in my 401(k). I earn $72,000. Am I doomed?
Trump says there are bigger China threats than TikTok. Here’s where he could be going wrong.
item.description: President Trump this week said “TikTok is largely about kids” and there are bigger threats. China hawks aren’t convinced.

item.title: The Score: Novo Nordisk, Oracle, Netflix, and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.5% to 101.80
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was down 0.5% to 101.80 — lower for two consecutive trading days.

item.title: This Financial Coach Is Ready to Fix Your Marriage Too
item.description: Ramit Sethi gets couples to open up for his shows, books, podcasts and a Netflix series

item.title: You Can Own Elon Musk's SpaceX. But at What Price?
item.description: An ETF that can trade all day is investing in an asset that rarely changes hands. Figuring out what it’s worth is a guessing game.

item.title: Corporate tax cuts don’t boost the economy — despite what many investors believe
item.description: Raising corporate taxes — not cutting them — frequently delivers faster economic growth.

item.title: Trump tariff talk is heating up on Wall Street, signaling a rocky road ahead for investors
item.description: S&P 500 companies’ mentions of tariffs on earnings calls have surged, according to Citi Research.
